intro: Chamaecrypta, commonly known as the rock fig or rock apple, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. These plants are native to regions of Africa, the Arabian Peninsula, and parts of Asia. They are characterized by their woody stems and clustered, opposite leaves. The small, greenish flowers are followed by edible, fig-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Chamaecrypta species are typically found growing on rocky surfaces, showcasing their adaptability to arid and semi-arid environments.
